blog.name: reliand
blog.title: Hips from the devil
blog.description: Sarah; almost exclusively a Reylo/Star Wars blog. Sometimes I art.

summary: Snoke wasn’t preying on Kylo in the womb, the only indication of that is in the same novel that reveals Snoke wasn’t interested...
question: Snoke wasn’t preying on Kylo in the womb, the only indication of that is in the same novel that reveals Snoke wasn’t interested in Kylo until he was 23 and it came out that he was related to Vader. The darkness Leia sensed was Kylo’s own potential. Snoke was interested in Kylo because he’s related to Vader and that was his main selling point in corrupting him. He had no way of knowing that he was prior to Bloodline. If it was based solely on force potential rey would have been targeted as well.
answer:
Look. You can say that he wasn’t targeted all you want, but it’s in the canon materials. Yeah, he didn’t know that he was related to Vader. That is also canon, BUT Snoke has been targeting him his whole life because he could feel how powerful he was in the force. It’s in the canon materials. This only indication isn’t spelled out word for word, because perhaps they think their readers are smart and don’t need their hand held to understand a concept. 

These excerpts indicate that Snoke was preying on him in the womb:

Excerpt 1:

Luke. She reaches for him but doesn’t find him.

The dark, now lit with stars. One by one, like eyes opening. Comforting at first, then sinister as she worries. Who is out there, who is watching us? Hands reach for her, hands of shadow, lifting her up, reaching for her throat, her wrists, her stomach—

Inside, the child kicks. She feels her baby turning inside, right-side, up and down, struggling to find his bearings, trying so hard to find his way free of her. It’s not time, she thinks. Just a little longer.

Leia.

Luke, she wants to cry out. But her words don’t come. Her mouth is sealed, a hand pressed over it. One by one, stars go dark again, winking out of existence as if by a hand slowly closing over them -

Leia!

She gasps and wakes. Han. It’s just Han. He’s by her side of the bed, rousing her, gently shaking her shoulder.

The dream recedes like a wave going back to sea.

Hi, she says, her mouth tacky, her eyes full of sleep. Her middle twists too - it’s not the baby. It’s some unseen fear uncoiling. The remnants of the dream haunt her - but they break apart like a sand castle as she sits up and clears her head, doing as Luke taught her to do.

Breathe in breathe out. Be mindful of the world, the galaxy, your place within it. Everything will be OK. The Force will be your guide.

Excerpt 2:

He [Baby Ben] is less a human shaped thing and more a pulsing, living band of light. Light that sometimes dims, that sometimes is thrust with a vein of darkness.

She [Leia] tells herself that it’s normal - Luke said to her, Leia, we all have that. He explained that the brighter the light, the darker the shadow.

Right now, her son is upset, tumbling inside her as if he can’t get comfortable. His light, flickering with dark. She centers herself and concentrates. The walls of the room fall away. Everything is white and then it’s black. Then she’s in the calm, airless void. As Leia finds her peace, so does her son. He stops turning…

Then he gets the hiccups.

Hic. Hic. Hic.

She sighs and it brings her out of it. But she laughs, too. Because the hiccups tickle her. They are like bubbles inside - a curious effervescence like nothing Leia ever felt before.

My son is alive. The future is bright.

…

The baby turns inside her again, troubled by something she cannot feel and cannot yet understand.


This TFA novelization dialogue also makes it clear that he was targeting Ben from the beginning:

“Leia bit her lower lip, refusing to concede. “No. It was Snoke.”

Han drew back slightly. “Snoke?”

She nodded. “He knew our child would be strong with the Force. That he was born with equal potential for good or evil.”

“You knew this from the beginning? Why didn’t you tell me?”

She sighed. “Many reasons. I was hoping that I was wrong, that it wasn’t true. I hoped I could sway him, turn him away from the dark side, without having to involve you.” A small smile appeared.

“You had—you have—wonderful qualities, Han, but patience and understanding were never among them. I was afraid that your reactions would only drive him farther to the dark side. I thought I could shield him from Snoke’s influence and you from what was happening.” Her voice dropped. “It’s clear now that I was wrong. Whether your involvement would have made a difference, we’ll never know.”

He had trouble believing what he was hearing. “So Snoke was watching our son.”

“Always,” she told him. “From the shadows, in the beginning, even before I realized what was happening, he was manipulating everything, pulling our son toward the dark side.”


You can say that he only came after Ben once he found out he was Vader’s grandchild, but that is not what the narrative is showing. We even have The Powers That Be explaining that Ben was preyed on. 

“It’s more than just having a ‘bad seed’ as a kid. Snoke had targeted this kid and knew that this kid was going to be incredibly powerful in the Force and wanted him as an ally.” - JJ Abrams

blog.name: angelqueen04
blog.title: all these tales untold
blog.description:
AngelQueen on Archive of Our Own.
My Tags here on Tumblr.

summary: fic idea
title: fic idea
body:
so you know how the council didn’t approve of palpatine always wanting to see/visit/talk to anakin all the time but couldn’t do anything about it because he’s chancellor? well, they couldn’t expressly forbid it, but there were certainly ways around it.

like, what if they decided that keeping anakin from a single person’s influence, who could warp his view of politics and whatnot, was more important than keeping him close so they could watch him and frown on every emotion he ever had? what if they transferred him and obi-wan off of coruscant, perhaps to a satellite temple somewhere further afield in the republic? that would do a fair bit to limit palpatine’s influence on anakin, and he can hardly demand that obi-wan and anakin be based on coruscant simply so he and anakin can have their weekly tea and biscuits chat. 

so the council decides to go with this, sending obi-wan and anakin out and away from coruscant, and for the next several years, anakin sees a lot of the corruption and greed that have infested the leaders of the republic, though he also sees the good ones too. still, it gives him a more balanced view of the republic, and it also allows him to learn when a politician is trying to manipulate him. he begins to see the signs, and becomes quite adept at avoiding them and using pranks to out the corrupt politicians. obi-wan is both proud and harried.

cut forward to aotc. padme has been doing her job very competently and inspires people to try and kill her. everyone tries to get her to accept jedi bodyguards, but she’s all, ‘no i need to know who is trying to kill me so i can shoot them and get on with doing my job’. obi-wan and anakin just happen to be on coruscant for once, reporting a sensitive mission directly to the council, and palpatine jumps at the chance to bring anakin back into his sphere of influence because he’s way behind on the corruption aspect of project revenge of the sith.

but it’s far more difficult because anakin’s no happy-go-lucky kid anymore. he’s been around. he’s got a good idea of how politicians run these days. some are good (like padme - his adoration of her has never faded), but a lot of them are bad, and he’s pretty good at spotting the bad ones.

so when palpatine tries to hook his manipulative claws into him, anakin’s savvy enough to notice. at first, he tries to write it off out of respect for palpatine’s kindness to a little boy who was the new kid on the block ten years ago, and side-steps it as best he can. plus, there’s a war on. but as the war drags on, and palpatine accumulates more and more power, he can’t keep hand-waving it. so he confides in obi-wan and padme about it. and given that padme’s part of the delegation of two thousand who have all noticed the bad stuff too, and obi-wan just straight up doesn’t like palpatine and his flouting the constitution and whatnot, regardless of the war, well, there’s actually a chance at some coordination here.

in the end, though, a sith gets skewered, the clones are freed, and people set to the business of giving the republic a complete overhaul. because i care for happy endings, that’s why.

so yeah, an au where anakin actually notices when he’s being manipulated.

so the council decides to go with this, sending obi-wan and anakin out and away from coruscant, and for the next several years, anakin sees a lot of the corruption and greed that have infested the leaders of the republic, though he also sees the good ones too. still, it gives him a more balanced view of the republic, and it also allows him to learn when a politician is trying to manipulate him. he begins to see the signs, and becomes quite adept at avoiding them and using pranks to out the corrupt politicians. obi-wan is both proud and harried.

cut forward to aotc. padme has been doing her job very competently and inspires people to try and kill her. everyone tries to get her to accept jedi bodyguards, but she’s all, ‘no i need to know who is trying to kill me so i can shoot them and get on with doing my job’. obi-wan and anakin just happen to be on coruscant for once, reporting a sensitive mission directly to the council, and palpatine jumps at the chance to bring anakin back into his sphere of influence because he’s way behind on the corruption aspect of project revenge of the sith.

but it’s far more difficult because anakin’s no happy-go-lucky kid anymore. he’s been around. he’s got a good idea of how politicians run these days. some are good (like padme - his adoration of her has never faded), but a lot of them are bad, and he’s pretty good at spotting the bad ones.

so when palpatine tries to hook his manipulative claws into him, anakin’s savvy enough to notice. at first, he tries to write it off out of respect for palpatine’s kindness to a little boy who was the new kid on the block ten years ago, and side-steps it as best he can. plus, there’s a war on. but as the war drags on, and palpatine accumulates more and more power, he can’t keep hand-waving it. so he confides in obi-wan and padme about it. and given that padme’s part of the delegation of two thousand who have all noticed the bad stuff too, and obi-wan just straight up doesn’t like palpatine and his flouting the constitution and whatnot, regardless of the war, well, there’s actually a chance at some coordination here.

in the end, though, a sith gets skewered, the clones are freed, and people set to the business of giving the republic a complete overhaul. because i care for happy endings, that’s why.

so yeah, an au where anakin actually notices when he’s being manipulated.

summary: So I was bored one day and decided to recreate my own version of my favorite scene from the movie ‘Shottas’ using my Nightstorm...
body: So I was bored one day and decided to recreate my own version of my favorite scene from the movie ‘Shottas’ using my Nightstorm Predator and my Prototype Black Series Boba Fett, which I still need to get painted. Either way I’m pretty proud of the results.

summary: Inside SOLO: A STAR WARS STORY
title: Inside SOLO: A STAR WARS STORY
body:
Inside SOLO: A STAR WARS STORY #HanSoloEvent #sponsored #SoloAStarWarsStory #HanSolo

Earlier this year, I had the awesome privilege of attending the SOLO: A STAR WARS STORY movie premiere.  Sitting in the same theater with legends like George Lucas, Mark Hamill, and Billy Dee Williams along with all the cast and crew of the new film was mind-blowing!

While it upped my awe and excitement factors, as a 40+ year Star Wars fan, you know I certainly had my reservations about the…

summary: John Mollo's original Star Wars designs go under the hammer at Bonhams
title: John Mollo's original Star Wars designs go under the hammer at Bonhams
body:
John Mollo’s original Star Wars designs go under the hammer at Bonhams

John Mollo’s sketch for a Stormtrooper from Star Wars. ©Lucasfilm Ltd / John Mollo

The personal notebooks and sketchbooks of world-renowned double Oscar-winning British costume designer, John Mollo, the concept artist behind the international Star Wars franchise, are to be offered at Bonhams in a stand-alone 62-lot sale, Designing an Empire: The John Mollo Archive, in London later this year.

The…
